data.title: Best R&B Love Songs | Top Romantic Rhythm & Blues Hits
data.meta_description: Dive into the best R&B love songs in English, with a humorous take on timeless romantic tunes & hidden gems. Get ready for a journey though romantic r&b songs!

Best R&B Love Songs: A Soulful Journey

Love makes the world go ’round, and nothing says “I love you” better than a sultry R&B tune. Let’s take a soulful journey through the best R&B love songs. No, we’re not talking about cheesy love songs here; we’re talking about those heart-melting, spine-tingling, make-you-wanna-dance-under-the-moonlight kind of jams!

The Golden Era of R&B Love Songs

Al Green – “Let’s Stay Together”

Al Green knew how to make you feel the love with this 70s classic. It’s the perfect soundtrack for dancing cheek to cheek with your sweetheart or serenading them from a balcony Romeo and Juliet style.

Marvin Gaye – “Sexual Healing”

It’s impossible to talk about R&B love songs without mentioning Marvin Gaye. “Sexual Healing” is the quintessential R&B slow jam that still makes hearts race and knees weak. Check out a guide to the best Marvin Gaye songs.

Teddy Pendergrass – “Close the Door”

Teddy Pendergrass taught us the importance of setting the mood with “Close the Door.” It’s the kind of song that makes you want to dim the lights, light some candles, and maybe even break out the silk sheets for one of the best R&B love songs.

Earth, Wind & Fire – “Reasons”

“Reasons” by Earth, Wind & Fire is a groovy, feel-good love song that will have you dancing in your living room with your significant other, even if you’ve got two left feet.

Chaka Khan – “Ain’t Nobody”

Chaka Khan’s “Ain’t Nobody” is an R&B classic that will make you believe in the power of love, even if you’ve been single since the dawn of time.

Check out our other R&B Guides

Ranking Songs on SZA’s CTRL

The 90s: Love in the Time of Boy Bands

Boyz II Men – “I’ll Make Love to You”

Boyz II Men became the poster children for 90s R&B love songs with this romantic hit. With smooth harmonies and a heartfelt message, it’s no wonder this song became a go-to for lovebirds everywhere.

TLC – “Red Light Special”

TLC gave us the ultimate love anthem with “Red Light Special.” If your love life needs a little spice, this is the track to turn up the heat.

Maxwell – “Ascension (Don’t Ever Wonder)”

Maxwell’s “Ascension (Don’t Ever Wonder)” is a silky-smooth love song that feels like diving headfirst into a pool of chocolate. It’s the perfect tune to put on when you’re looking to impress your date with your impeccable taste in music.

Janet Jackson – “That’s the Way Love Goes”

Janet Jackson showed us that love can be a rollercoaster with her hit “That’s the Way Love Goes.” It’s the perfect song to listen to while you’re smooching in the backseat of a car at the drive-in.

En Vogue – “Don’t Let Go (Love)”

En Vogue gave us a heart-wrenching love ballad with “Don’t Let Go (Love).” This song is perfect for those moments when you’re holding on to love with all your might, even if it feels like you’re dangling from a cliff by a thread.

The 2000s: Love Gets a Modern Makeover

Usher – “U Got It Bad”

Usher showed us the power of love (and his killer dance moves) with “U Got It Bad.” This song is perfect for when you can’t get that special someone out of your head.

Alicia Keys – If I Ain’t Got You

Alicia Keys reminded us that love is more important than material possessions with “If I Ain’t Got You.” This powerful ballad will have you belting out your love from the rooftops of the tallest buildings. Want to understand why Alicia Keys is a legend in the music industry? Explore her best songs here.

Ne-Yo – So Sick

Ne-Yo’s “So Sick” is a tearjerker that captures the feeling of heartache like no other. Warning: this song may cause spontaneous ugly crying in public places.

Beyoncé – Irreplaceable

Beyoncé’s “Irreplaceable” is a sassy and empowering love song that reminds us that we don’t need to put up with anyone’s nonsense. Keep this tune handy for when you need to remind yourself (or someone else) that you’re a catch.

John Legend – Ordinary People

John Legend’s “Ordinary People” is a beautifully honest portrayal of love in its rawest form. This song will make you want to sit down at a piano, pour your heart out, and maybe even shed a tear or two.

Hidden Gems: Underrated R&B Love Songs

D’Angelo – Untitled (How Does It Feel)

D’Angelo’s “Untitled (How Does It Feel)” is a sensual love song that will make your heart race and your palms sweaty. Find D’angelo on our list of 10 classic r&b albums.

Jazmine Sullivan – Lions, Tigers & Bears

Jazmine Sullivan’s “Lions, Tigers & Bears” is an ode to love’s wild and untamed nature. It’s the kind of song that makes you want to brave the jungle of emotions, even if you’re afraid of the wild beasts lurking in the shadows.

Lauryn Hill – Nothing Even Matters

Lauryn Hill and D’Angelo teamed up to create this timeless love song that makes you feel like you’re floating on cloud nine. “Nothing Even Matters” is the song that makes you want to hold your loved one close and never let go.

Erykah Badu – Next Lifetime

Erykah Badu’s “Next Lifetime” is a mystical love song that will have you contemplating past lives and wondering if your soulmate is out somewhere, waiting to be found.

Jill Scott – A Long Walk

Jill Scott’s “A Long Walk” is a sweet and simple ode to love, reminding us that sometimes, all we need is a stroll hand-in-hand with our special someone.

Frank Ocean – Thinkin Bout You

Frank Ocean’s “Thinkin Bout You” is an introspective love song that captures the vulnerability of being head over heels for someone. It’s the perfect song to listen to while you doodle hearts in your notebook, daydreaming about your crush.

From the golden era of R&B love songs to hidden gems that deserve more recognition, we’ve taken you on a soulful journey through the best R&B love songs in English. So, whether you’re looking to set the mood for a romantic night in or want to remind yourself of the magic of love, this playlist has got you covered. Now go on and let your heart sing along to these irresistible tunes – or better yet, grab your partner and dance the night away under the stars.

Best R&B Love Songs: Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What is the number one most romantic song?

A: Determining the most romantic song ever can be quite subjective, as it varies from person to person. However, some might argue that Whitney Houston’s I Will Always Love You holds the crown, with its soaring vocals and heartfelt message.

Q: What is the most popular love song of the 90s?

A: The 90s were a treasure trove of love songs, but Boyz II Men’s End of the Road stands out as one of that decade’s most popular and enduring love ballads.

Q: Who has the most R&B hits of all time?

A: With a career spanning over several decades, R. Kelly is known for having the most R&B hits. However, due to recent controversies, many people prefer to focus on other prolific R&B artists like Beyoncé, Stevie Wonder, or Mariah Carey.

Q: What is the best love song ever written?

A: Opinions on the best love song ever written vary, but many people consider Something by The Beatles one of the most beautiful and timeless love songs in history.

Q: What is the best love song for your boyfriend?

A: Finding the perfect love song for your boyfriend depends on his taste and relationship. However, Adore You by Harry Styles is a modern love song that many people adore for its romantic lyrics and catchy melody.

Q: What is the best love song for your girlfriend?

A: The ideal love song for your girlfriend should reflect her personality and your connection. Make You Feel My Love by Adele could be a great choice, with its heartfelt lyrics and beautiful melody.

Q: Who is the best love song singer?

A: Picking the best love song singer is like choosing your favorite ice cream flavor – everyone has a different favorite. However, some notable love song singers include Whitney Houston, Marvin Gaye, Celine Dion, and Luther Vandross. Their voices and songs have been melting hearts for decades.
